node.title: Alinghi confirm F1 partnership for America's Cup challenge
node.description: Former America's Cup holders Alinghi have linked up with Formula One team Red Bull Racing for the next edition of the regatta.

node.title: Boris Johnson's New COVID Restrictions Set Off Backlash From His Conservative Party
node.description: The new mandates were economically damaging and limited individual freedoms, argued many Conservatives legislators, with one calling them "a slippery slope."

node.title: Remains Found in Garbage Bag Almost 40 Years Ago Now Identified as Former O'Jays Guitarist
node.description: The remains found in Twinsburg, Ohio in 1982 were recently identified by local authorities as Frank Little, who had been missing for over 40 years.

node.title: SA records highest daily COVID-19 total since April last year, as international quarantine time cut
node.description: South Australia records 26 new cases of COVID-19, the highest daily total since April 2020. The Premier says quarantine periods for international arrivals will reduce from 14 to seven days.

node.title: SA oysters set to return to Christmas menus as shutdown eases
node.description: Coffin Bay oyster growers breathe a sigh of relief as production restrictions are gradually lifted following a gastro outbreak that halted sales at the busiest time of year.

node.title: Former cricketer Michael Slater arrested for allegedly breaching an AVO
node.description: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater is refused bail after allegedly breaching an apprehended violence order two months after being charged with stalking and harassment offences over an alleged domestic violence incident.

node.title: Police call off latest search for William Tyrrell
node.description: Police had spent the last four weeks scouring areas near Kendall on the NSW Mid North Coast as they search for clues into the missing toddler.

node.title: Student Job Search helps fill vacancies in agriculture, fishing and forestry
node.description: There's been a 76 percent increase in the number of roles Student Job Search is offering in agriculture, fishing and forestry - and student earnings from those jobs have more than doubled.

node.title: Taranaki town on alert after one Covid-19 case at school grows to 11
node.description: The isolated case of Covid-19 in the Taranaki township of Eltham has grown into a cluster involving a single class at the local primary school.

node.title: Covid-19: Counties Manukau DHB hits 90% fully vaccinated target
node.description: Auckland's Counties Manukau District Health Board has hit the vaccination target of having its eligible population fully vaccinated.

node.title: Stephen Curry breaks NBA career 3-point record
node.description: Curry hit his 2,974th 3-pointer Tuesday night in the first quarter of the Golden State Warriors' game against the New York Knicks, breaking the record set by Ray Allen.

node.title: Keechant Sewell to Lead N.Y.P.D. as Its First Female Commissioner
node.description: The selection of Ms. Sewell, the Nassau County chief of detectives, was seen as one of Eric Adams’s most critical appointments as incoming mayor.

node.title: Marginalized by Her Party, Cheney Takes Center Stage in Jan. 6 Inquiry
node.description: Representative Liz Cheney has embraced a prominent role in the House investigation of the Jan. 6 attack, using her perch to hold up an unsparing mirror to the Republican Party.

node.title: Biden's Pick to Head FDA, Robert Califf, Says 'Price of Pharmaceuticals Is Way Too High'
node.description: Califf said that his reasoning for returning to the FDA is public service, saying that he is "a 70-year-old person with nothing to gain."

node.title: Amazon Selling 'Grinch' Shirts Accusing Biden, Dominion Voting of 'Stealing' Election
node.description: Dominion has filed lawsuits against multiple organizations and individuals for falsely claiming the company helped "steal" the 2020 election from Donald Trump.

node.title: Bobby Bostic, 42, Sentenced to 241 Years as a Teen, Granted Parole After Judge Changes Stance
node.description: The judge who sentenced Bostic to life in prison in 1997 and advocated for his parole said so much has been discovered about brains of young people since then.

node.title: South Carolina Sheriff Charles Lemon Indicted, Joins Long List of Troubled SC Sheriffs
node.description: Marlboro County Sheriff Charles Lemon was indicted on charges of assault and battery of a high and aggravated nature and misconduct in office.

node.title: Mass. Health Experts Urge Indoor Masks on Heels of Gov. Charlie Baker's Mandate Denial
node.description: Governor Charlie Baker previously stated that there would be no statewide mask mandates in Massachusetts despite a sizable uptick in recent COVID cases.

node.title: Malta becomes first European nation to approve cannabis for personal use
node.description: Malta becomes the first European country to allow limited cultivation and possession of cannabis for personal use, following a vote in parliament.

node.title: Qantas adds non-stop Perth to Rome flights after border open date is revealed
node.description: A direct flight to Rome will complement the non-stop London route as the state readies for international travel in the wake of WA's border announcement.

node.title: Driver, 60, weeps as he is jailed for crash that killed mother and son
node.description: Michael Knowler will serve less than two years in prison after pleading guilty to causing a crash that killed Jessica West and her son Deighton in 2019.

node.title: Warning as government announces new biodiversity trading platform
node.description: Farmers will earn income for improving the biodiversity on farm but scientists and community groups warn that too much land may be lost to productive agriculture.

node.title: Meet the young leaders behind some of Australia's most successful companies
node.description: The tech industry is behind many of Australia's newest millionaires and fastest growing companies. Here's how three Australian entrepreneurs made it.

node.title: As Australia opens up, the Omicron COVID-19 variant is spreading fast. So how bad is it?
node.description: With the Omicron variant spreading fast around the world and set to become the dominant COVID-19 strain in the UK, there is one question everyone wants to know.

node.title: RBNZ loses two more senior staff in restructure
node.description: The central bank's supervision head Andy Wood, and financial system policy and analysis head Toby Fiennes have opted not to take roles in the revamped structure.

node.title: Canterbury in for a drenching as rain system moves south
node.description: Heavy rain that drenched parts of the country overnight has headed south to Canterbury, where Christchurch City Council has pumps on standby in case of flooding.

node.title: NCEA exams attendance below half in Auckland
node.description: The low attendance was due to a new rule that ensured students in Auckland, and also those in Northland and parts of Waikato, automatically received an unexpected event grade.

node.title: New independent redress system for abuse survivors to be set up
node.description: Public Service Minister Chris Hipkins acknowledges there have been failings in providing redress, and says it's "a national disgrace" that it has taken this long to get to this point.

node.title: Plagued by Fan Violence, French Soccer Asks: Why?
node.description: The return of supporters to stadiums in France has been accompanied by a series of games postponed or marred by trouble in the stands.

node.title: How Tech Reveals the ‘Secret Lives’ of Animals
node.description: Tiny sensors can help scientists track and learn about some wildlife, before it disappears.
